From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To enable a router to do a warm-reboot, use the **warm-reboot** command in global configuration mode. To disable warm rebooting, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Maximum number of warm reboots allowed between any intervening cold reboot. Valid values range from 1 to 50. The default value is 5 times.

(Optional) Minimum number of minutes that must elapse between initial system configuration and an exception before a warm reboot is attempted. If the system crashes before the specified time elapses, a warm reboot is not attempted. Valid values range from 0 to 120. The default value is 5Â minutes.

ExtraInfo: Use the **warm-reboot** command to enable the router to reload a Cisco IOS image without ROM monitor mode (ROMMON) intervention, in which the image restores read-write data from a previously saved copy in the RAM and starts execution from that point. Unlike a cold reboot, this process does not involve a flash to RAM copy or self-decompression of the image.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)After a warm reboot is enabled, it will not become active until after the next cold reboot because a warm reboot requires a copy of the initialized memory.---![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)If the system crashes before the image completes the warm reboot process, a cold reboot is initiated.---
